page.text: 4115 Cassidy Park Ln
acellis34@gmail.com
Katy, TX, USA 77450
A hard-working and quick-learning graduate of Yale University who is energetic and determined to succeed. Proven leadership
and critical thinking skills help drive a desire to accomplish any goal I set for myself. Self-motivated worker who demonstrates a
commitment to excellence and enthusiastically welcomes any challenge. Currently seeking to build and continue a burgeoning
career in the energy industry, particularly in oil and gas.
Yale University (Class of 2015) – New Haven, CT
-Bachelor of Arts in Political Science
-2012 George R. Eidemueller Scholar for academic achievement
London School of Economics (Summer of 2013) – London, England
-Invited to study International Relations and Global Affairs
-Chosen due to demonstrated academic success in these fields at Yale
Cinco Ranch High School (Class of 2011) —Katy, TX
-Graduated with Honors (4.1 GPA, 2190 SAT)
-2010 National Hispanic Recognition Program Scholar

text.b: Land Department Intern – Samuel Gary Jr. & Associates (2014) – Denver, CO

page.text: -Helped build the database of leases, contracts, and other legal documents for an oil and gas E&P in Denver
-Main focus on land department operations, gaining in-depth experience using programs like BOLO and iLandman
-Took a lead role in transferring one of the largest leasehold acquisitions in company history into existing databases
-Worked on projects with the Engineering and Geology departments, expanding my horizons in the energy sector

text.b: Yale Athletics and Intramurals Office (2012-2015) – New Haven, CT

page.text: -Year-round work as an Intramural referee for sports including Football, Volleyball, and Hockey
-Member of Event Staff and Set-Up Staff, helping organize competitions in Yale’s Payne Whitney Gym and Ingalls Rink

text.b: Windows 8 Promotion Team Member (2013) – New Haven, CT

page.text: -Served as a “Windows Techspert” in Windows’ College Campus Tour, promoting the new Windows 8 OS
-Student liaison between the Yale Community and the Windows Team, helping bring in more students to the event

text.b: Social Media Intern – City of Houston Mayor’s Office (2012) – Houston, TX

page.text: -Employed through the ExxonMobil Community Summer Jobs Program, using social media to promote volunteerism

text.b: Strength and Conditioning Camp Instructor (2013) – Katy, TX

page.text: -Coached the Faith West Academy summer strength and conditioning program alongside FWA Football Coaches
-Tutored many students in various subjects such as Algebra, Geometry, and Pre-Calc, as well as SAT prep
-Delta Kappa Epsilon Fraternity – Phi Chapter (2011-2015)
-Founding member of three student organizations, some reaching over 1000 students
-Yale University Football Team (2011) and Rugby Team (2011-2013)
-Other clubs including the Yale Political Union and the Yale Fly Fishing Club (2013-2015)
-High School Football (Texas 5A) – 2007-2010 – State Semifinalist and recipient of All-District honors
-Volunteer Work – ongoing – working with organizations like Katy Christian Ministries and the Houston SPCA
-Strong leadership skills exemplified through athletic performance and the founding of multiple student organizations
-Very established people skills developed through tutoring, coaching, refereeing, and working as a Windows representative
-Clear and extensive knowledge of computer functions and systems, as well as installations of hardware and software
-Proficiency with basic computer programs such as Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Outlook, databases like BOLO
and iLandman, as well as computer design programs such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, as well as assisting in web design
-Moderate ability to speak Spanish and Indonesian, continuously working towards fluency
